verses.kjv: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.
verses.web: I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valleys.
verses.ct: I am a wildflower of Sharon, a lily growing in the valleys.

verses.kjv: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
verses.web: As a lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
verses.ct: Like a lily among thorns — that's what my love is compared to all other women.

verses.kjv: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
verses.web: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, his fruit was sweet to my taste.
verses.ct: Like an apple tree standing among the trees of the forest — that's what my beloved is compared to all other men. I sat down in his shade with pure delight, and his fruit was sweet on my lips.

verses.kjv: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
verses.web: He brought me to the banquet hall. His banner over me is love.
verses.ct: He brought me into the banquet hall, and his banner over me was love.

verses.kjv: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
verses.web: Strengthen me with raisins, refresh me with apples; for I am faint with love.
verses.ct: Strengthen me with raisins, refresh me with apples — I am overwhelmed with love.

verses.kjv: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
verses.web: His left hand is under my head. His right hand embraces me.
verses.ct: His left hand cradles my head, and his right arm holds me close.

verses.kjv: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
verses.web: I adjure you, daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, or by the hinds of the field, that you not stir up, nor awaken love, until it so desires.
verses.ct: I beg you, daughters of Jerusalem — by the gazelles and the wild deer — don't stir up or awaken love until it's ready.

verses.kjv: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
verses.web: The voice of my beloved! Behold, he comes, leaping on the mountains, skipping on the hills.
verses.ct: Listen! It's my beloved! Here he comes, leaping across the mountains, bounding over the hills.

verses.kjv: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.
verses.web: My beloved is like a roe or a young deer. Behold, he stands behind our wall! He looks in at the windows. He glances through the lattice.
verses.ct: My beloved is like a gazelle or a young deer. Look — he's standing just behind our wall, peering through the windows, gazing through the lattice.

verses.kjv: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
verses.web: My beloved spoke, and said to me, “Rise up, my love, my beautiful one, and come away.
verses.ct: My beloved spoke to me and said, "Get up, my love, my beautiful one — come away with me."

verses.kjv: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;
verses.web: For behold, the winter is past. The rain is over and gone.
verses.ct: "Look, the winter is over. The rains have come and gone."

verses.kjv: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
verses.web: The flowers appear on the earth. The time of the singing has come, and the voice of the turtledove is heard in our land.
verses.ct: "Flowers are blooming across the land. The season for singing has arrived, and the call of the turtledove fills our countryside."

verses.kjv: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
verses.web: The fig tree ripens her green figs. The vines are in blossom. They give out their fragrance. Arise, my love, my beautiful one, and come away.”
verses.ct: "The fig trees are forming their early fruit, and the grapevines are blossoming with sweet fragrance. Get up, my love, my beautiful one — come away with me."

verses.kjv: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
verses.web: My dove in the clefts of the rock, in the hiding places of the mountainside, let me see your face. let me hear your voice; for your voice is sweet and your face is lovely.
verses.ct: "My dove, hiding in the clefts of the rock, tucked away on the mountainside — let me see your face. Let me hear your voice. Your voice is so sweet, and your face is so lovely."

verses.kjv: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.
verses.web: Catch for us the foxes, the little foxes that plunder the vineyards; for our vineyards are in blossom.
verses.ct: Catch the foxes for us — the little foxes that ruin the vineyards — because our vines are in bloom.

verses.kjv: My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.
verses.web: My beloved is mine, and I am his. He browses among the lilies.
verses.ct: My beloved is mine, and I am his. He wanders among the lilies.

verses.kjv: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
verses.web: Until the day is cool, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be like a roe or a young deer on the mountains of Bether.
verses.ct: Until the day breaks and the shadows slip away, come back to me, my beloved. Be like a gazelle or a young deer on the mountains of Bether.
